text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies! Today I have a special

Ro: guest, Erin! Erin: Hello! Ro: You guys may
recognize her, we baked Domo Kun Brownies

Ro: together. Erin: Yes, and they were so
fun! Ro: They were so good!
Erin: So yummy!
Ro: Domo brownies! Erin: Yay! Ro: High fives!
Ro: That was a body slam.
Ro: She’s anime… Both: Enthusiast!

Ro: So I’ll put a link down below if you
want to go check out her channel, it’s

Ro: All about anime! And it’s really, really
cool!

Ro: Today, we are gonna be baking. Erin: Nyan
Cat… Ro: Homemade PopTarts.
Erin: Yes! Ro: Yes!
Erin: Mew! Ro: Mew! Erin: Mew, mew! Ro: Mewwww!
Erin: Mew! Ro: Mew!
Ro: Let’s get started!

Erin: Things you will need: A mixing bowl,
your favorite pie crust recipe or pie

Erin: crust mix, strawberry jam, a paintbrush,
egg, some water…

Ro: A fork, a rectangular cut-out, rolling
pin, big knife, and some flour!
Erin: Meow! Ro: Let’s put this together!
Erin: Yeah!

Erin: For this pie crust, all you need is
some water. So I’m just gonna dump it in here.

Ro: There we go. Erin: You pour that water
baby!

Ro: Then I’m pouring in 1/3 cup of water.
And then we’re just gonna mix it together.

Erin: Once your pie crust is all mixed, then
you’re going to roll it out.

Ro: So we’re gonna take a little bit of
flour, just taking a little handful.

Ro: This is a really thin cutting board mat
that I’m using, but you can just cut on

Ro: top of your table if you want to but,
I just didn’t want to scratch the table,
Ro: More than it already is! So…
Ro: And then... Erin: Oh yeah! Ro: Take a handful, you can take a handful too! Erin: Yes!

Erin: Oh, I messed up. Ro: And… That’s
OK! That’s OK! That’s really good!

Erin: I really messed up! Ro: Steal your friend’s
dough!

Erin: If your friend messes up and make a
giant mess. Ro: Take all of their dough.
Ro: Now, just roll him out! Erin: OK.

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your rectangle
cut out, boop-boop-boop! I just cut this

Ro: out, out of the pie box! So nothing fancy,
just a little piece of cardboard,

Ro: whatever shape you want your pop tart
to be. I wanted them to be a little

Ro: larger, so, going with that. And then
we’re gonna take a big knife,

Ro: and cut it out. And you’re gonna cut
out 2 of them,
Ro: 1 for the top, 1 for the bottom.

Ro: Once you’ve cut out all your rectangles,
we’re gonna fill them with jam!

Erin: How much do I do? Just 1 spoonful? Ro:
About a spoonful, just like that.

Ro: Right in the middle. Erin: Like that?
So that’s enough?

Ro: And then spread it really flat. Around
the border, you’re gonna put a little

Ro: bit of egg wash, and all egg wash is,
is a little bit of water and then

Ro: 1 egg white, and that’s what I have the
little paintbrush for.

Ro: Now you’re just gonna take the egg wash
with the little paint brush and just

Ro: brush all the outer edges, so that your
top piece will stick.

Ro: Do you want to try to pick up the top
piece and put it on the top?

Erin: I might ruin it, I might ruin it! Ro:
I trust you!

Erin: Oh no! That’s not good. Ro: We’re
gonna get crazy, let’s do it!

Ro: Just pick it up, yeah… Erin: I don’t
want to, I’m so nervous, oh no!

Ro: You got it, I’ll spot ya! Like a coach
at the gym.

Erin: If I mess up I want you to stay my friend.
Ro: I’ll spot ya!
Erin: Oh god I already messed up. Ro: Here you go, ready?
Erin: Thanks Ro! Ro: We can do it, we can do it! Erin: You got all my mess off!
Ro: We can do it together with friendship! Erin: OK, so then... So then just like that?
Ro: Yeah, just connect the ends. I'm pressing

Ro: down lightly on the edges, but then we’re
gonna go around and use a fork.

Ro: High five! Erin: Oh, that was really bad…
Ro: That was really bad.
Erin: I’ve… Uhhhhh. Ro: Ohhhh.

Ro: Now you take a fork and you’re gonna
use the edges, press down, all the way

Ro: around, roop! Like so! Here, you do the
other long side.

Erin: Do I need to go more in? Ro: No that’s
good! Erin: Oh it, oh.
Ro: That’s OK, that’s OK!

Ro: He’s a unique sunflower! Erin: Look
at him!
Ro: Err, ah, snowflake… What am I saying?

Ro: Once you’ve put them all together, now
we’re gonna stick ‘em in the oven,
Ro: at 450 and bake for 7 minutes.
Erin: Oooh! Ro: Oh yeah! Erin: Oh yeah!
Ro: Yeah, these are gonna get hot! Erin: Oh man! Ro: Yeah! Erin: yeah!
Ro: Dang, every time we try to high five…

Ro: While the PopTarts are baking, we are
going to make the decorations.

Ro: Erin is Vannah-ing this piece of paper,
where I printed out little Nyan Cat.
Erin: Nyah-nyah! Ro: Heads.

Ro: And, they can also stick to Erin, she’s
so talented. Erin: Hold. Ro: Watch this.
Both: Ahhhhh!

Ro: That’s magic, I learned it from Harry
Potter!

Ro: So we’re gonna take this piece of paper,
and tape it on a piece of cardboard.

Erin: You want it this way or flipped? Ro: Uh,
yeah that’s good.

Ro: Then you’re gonna take a piece of wax
paper, and put it on top,

Ro: and tape down the edges, make sure it’s
nice and tight.

Ro: Now you’re gonna take cookie icings,
I made up these 4 bags,

Ro: we have gray, white… Erin: Pink and
black! Ro: Yeah! Erin: Yeah!

Ro: And we’re just gonna trace out the shape
and let it sit for a few hours.

Ro: Make sure it’s completely dried before
you try to pick it up and put it
Ro: on top of the PopTart.

Ro: Ding! They’re done! They’re all out
of the oven, make sure they’ve had plenty of

Ro: time to cool before you start to decorate.
What you’ll need is: your pink

Ro: cookie icing. Erin: Oooh! Ro: And… Erin:
Sprinkles!
Ro: They’re red, red sugar sprinkles!
Ro: Let’s put this together!

Ro: Now we are gonna add the little kitty
heads, the little mew-mew heads!

Erin: Aw, so cute! Ro: And just be really,
really careful, make sure they’ve had

Ro: plenty of time to dry, and if you want
you can even leave them out overnight

Ro: to make sure that they’ve completely
dried.

Ro: It just depends how thick the frosting
is.

Ro: And then you’re going to very carefully,
I use the edge of the table,
Ro: to just work, the frosting, off of the wax paper! This is a really slow sentence! Erin: Careful!
Ro: And then, gently put it on top!

Both: Come on, come on, come on! Ro: Come
on kitty! Erin: Yeah, yeah! Yeah!
Ro: Ohhh! Yeah he’s so cute! Erin: Perfect!

Ro: This is another high five time. Erin:
Can we get it right this time?
Erin: No! Ro: Dang it! That’s 3 for 3!

Ro: We’ve got all the frosting on, and then
their little mew-mew heads. And then we

Ro: sprinkled them on top, and now, with all
of these. Erin: Oh wow!

Ro: Uh, Erin, you take these. With all of
these! We are going to make Rainbow butt!
Ro: At the end of our PopTart.

Erin: This poor guy… Ro: Yeah, he’s…
Erin: He got a little, he got a little derpy.

Ro: He, had not completely cooled, he was
a little bit too warm

Ro: when we put on the cookie icing. It will
be the first to be eaten!
Erin: Ha-ha wow! Ro: Ah-rah-rah-rah-rah-rah-rah!
Both: Ta-da! Erin Aw!

Ro: They turned out so cute! Thanks you guys
for suggesting it.

Ro: Again, I will put Erin’s link down below,
so if you want to check out her

Ro: channel, please do so if you like anime or
anything cute and adorable!
Erin: Yeah, aw! So sweet! Ro: Yeah!

Ro: Please let me know which Nerdy Nummies
you would like me to make next, and

Ro: I will do my best to make it happen. Also,
a reminder, you can subscribe,

Ro: there’s a button around here for a reminder
that Nerdy Nummies comes out every
Ro: Tuesday! Yeah! Erin: Yeee!

Ro: OK, bye-bye you guys! Erin: Bye-bye! Ro:
Bye-bye! Erin: Bee-bee!
